subsection.title: Vector algebra
subsection.p: Here we list the basic rules of algebra for vectors in \R^n. There is no need to prove these rules like we did for the rules of matrix algebra in , because we know from that vectors in \R^n can be converted into column vectors ( column matrices) and then the vector operations of addition, negation, and scalar multiplication all work as with matrices. Since the following rules are all valid when the vectors are replaced by column matrices, they are all valid for vectors in \R^n.
